qas.question: What group heads up the Global Plan to Stop Tuberculosis?
In what year did the WHO say tuberculosis was a "global health emergency"?
How many lives did the Stop TB Partnership vow to save in the nine years between its start and 2015?
Drug-resistant TB is one of the barriers to success of the Stop TB Partnership's initiative; what's the other other?
What organization created a system to classify various types of TB?

plausible_answers.text: a Global Plan to Stop Tuberculosis

qas.question: What did the World Health Organization create in 2006?
How many lives has Stop TB Partnership saved?
When was the World Health Organization founded?
Who developed the classification of HIV-associated TB?
When was the tuberculosis classification system created?

context: The World Health Organization declared TB a "global health emergency" in <a1_0><b7_0>1993<b7_0/><a1_0/>, and in <b9_0>2006<b9_0/>, the <a0_0>Stop TB Partnership<a0_0/> developed <b5_0>a Global Plan to Stop Tuberculosis<b5_0/> that aims to save <a2_0><b6_0>14 million<b6_0/><a2_0/> lives between its launch and 2015. A number of targets they have set are not likely to be achieved by 2015, mostly due to the increase in <a3_0>HIV-associated tuberculosis<a3_0/> and the emergence of multiple drug-resistant tuberculosis. A tuberculosis classification system developed by the <a4_0><b8_0>American Thoracic Society<b8_0/><a4_0/> is used primarily in public health programs.
